passage_text: Average Computer Technician salaries for job postings in Dallas, TX are 2% higher than average Computer Technician salaries for job postings nationwide.

National Salary Information. Computer and office machine repairmen reported an average hourly wage of $18.44 and an average salary of $38,360 per year to the Bureau of Labor Statistics, or BLS, as of May 2011. The median-earning 50 percent of computer and office machine repair technicians reported annual incomes ranging from $28,030 to $46,520, while the highest-paid 10 percent made $57,790 or more annually.
Average PC Technician salaries for job postings in Dallas, TX are 2% higher than average PC Technician salaries for job postings nationwide.

Across the United States, computer repair technicians working in the Northeast reported the highest average salaries. Technicians in Connecticut ranked first by state with an average salary of $47,350, while both Massachusetts and Minnesota reported average salaries of just over $44,000 per year. The median-earning 50 percent of computer and office machine repair technicians reported annual incomes ranging from $28,030 to $46,520, while the highest-paid 10 percent made $57,790 or more annually.

Dallas, TX Salary. Dallas, TX average salary is $63,110, median salary is $57,194 with a salary range from $18,880 to $1,320,144. Dallas, TX salaries are collected from government agencies and companies. Each salary is associated with a real job position. Dallas, TX salary statistics is not exclusive and is for reference only.

The salary for someone with the job title Pharmacy Technician I in Dallas, TX varies depending on a number of factors. This chart describes the expected percentage of people who perform the job of Pharmacy Technician I in Dallas, TX that make less than that salary.

Salaries for Dallas-Fort Worth area technology professionals rose 2 percent to an average of $86,136 in 2012 from 2011, according to the annual Dice Salary Survey released today. – Entry-level techies – those with two years or less of experience — earned their first annual wage increase in three years, up 8 percent to an average of $46,315. – The average salary for someone with at least 15 years of experience topped six-figures for the first time, up 4 percent from 2011.
